DISCLAIMER
      These programs work for me, but no warrantee or guarantee is made
      by me or Meijer, Inc. about their correct operation.  Run them at
      your own risk.

      Kevin Williams
      Meijer, Inc., 982/2
      2727 Walker Avenue NW
      Grand Rapids, MI  49504
      (616) 791-3621


   MEMBER     DESCRIPTION
   ------     -----------
   $$DOC      This member

   #RTN       Standard linkage macro borrowed from the NaSPA VIP tape

   #SLC       Standard linkage macro borrowed from the NaSPA VIP tape

   FORTUNE    This is an edited fortune cookie file from an old DEC
              PDP-11 RSTS/E system that I've been carrying around with
              me for more than 10 years.  I've cleaned it up quite a
              bit and made it easy for anyone to format:  Just add your
              own .QUOTE and .ATTR macros and run it through your
              favorite text processor (or DCF).  I believe it came from
              an old DECUS tape, so it should be public domain.

   PELISTR5   Modified version of Michael Gearing's PELIST program from
              file 18 of the NaSPA VIP tape.  I have modified it to
              work with SMP/E Release 5 zones.

   SMLDATA    An entire season of bowling scores for SMLSTAT

   SMLJCL     Sample JCL to run SMLSTAT

   SMLSTAT    Bowling statistics program written in PL/I.  I wrote this
              program specifically for my league (Seymour Men's League)
              for use with a Xerox 4045 printer, so it will probably
              need to be modified for other leagues and/or printers.
              It's not incredibly well documented, so anybody who
              wants to use it and has any questions should feel free to
              call me.

   VTOCSCAN   Program to scan all online DASD VTOCs for non-zero values
              in the four reserved bytes beginning at offset x'4E' in
              the DSCBs.  This program is useful if you run third-party
              DASD management software (e.g. DMS) and are planning to
              install DFP Version 3.

#SLC.text:
MACRO
&LABEL   #SLC
.*---------------------------------------------------------------------
.*
.*       STANDARD LINKAGE MACRO
.*
.*---------------------------------------------------------------------
         LCLA  &AA,&BB,&CC
&AA      SETA  1
&LABEL   CSECT
         SAVE  (14,12),,'&LABEL &SYSPARM &SYSDATE &SYSTIME '
         USING &LABEL,&SYSLIST(1)  INFORM ASSEMBLER
         LR    &SYSLIST(1),R15    SET BASE
         LA    R1,SAVEAREA
         B     START
SAVEAREA DC    18F'0'
START    EQU   *
         ST    R13,4(R1)           SAVE BACK CHAIN
         ST    R1,8(R13)           SET FORWARD CHAIN
         L     R1,24(R13)          RESTORE REG 1
         LA    R13,SAVEAREA        SET SAVEAREA POINTER
.LOOP    ANOP
&AA      SETA  &AA+1
&CC      SETA  &CC+4096
         AIF   (&AA GT N'&SYSLIST).DONE
&BB      SETA  &AA-1
         USING &LABEL+&CC,&SYSLIST(&AA) INFORM ASSEMBLER
         LA    &SYSLIST(&AA),2048(&SYSLIST(&BB))  LOAD NEXT BASE REG
         LA    &SYSLIST(&AA),2048(&SYSLIST(&AA))  LOAD NEXT BASE REG
         AGO   .LOOP
.DONE    ANOP
R0       EQU   0
R1       EQU   1
R2       EQU   2
R3       EQU   3
R4       EQU   4
R5       EQU   5
R6       EQU   6
R7       EQU   7
R8       EQU   8
R9       EQU   9
R10      EQU   10
R11      EQU   11
R12      EQU   12
R13      EQU   13
R14      EQU   14
R15      EQU   15
.*---------------------------------------------------------------------
.*---------------------------------------------------------------------
         MEND

FORTUNE.text:
.QUOTE
$100 placed at 7 percent interest compounded quarterly for 200 years will
increase to more than $100,000,000 -- by which time it will be worth nothing.
.ATTR Lazarus Long
.QUOTE
'Tis a common proof, that lowliness is a Edward Young ambition's ladder,
whereto the climber upwards turns his face; but when he once attains the utmost
round, he then unto the ladder turns his back, looks into the clouds scorning
the base degrees by which he did ascend.
.ATTR Shakespeare
.QUOTE
'Tis better that a man's own works, than that another man's words should praise
him.
.ATTR L'Estrange
.QUOTE
'Tis distance lends enchantment to the view, And robes the mountain in its
azure hue.
.ATTR Campbell
.QUOTE
'Tis easier for the generous to forgive, Than for offense to ask it.
.ATTR Thomson
.QUOTE
'Tis education forms the common mind.  Just as the twig is bent, the tree's
inclin'd
.ATTR Alexander Pope
.QUOTE
'Tis home felt pleasure prompts the patriot's sigh; This makes him wish to live
and dare to die.
.ATTR Campbell
.QUOTE
'Tis in my memory lock'd, And you yourself shall keep the key of it.
.ATTR Shakespeare
.QUOTE
'Tis late before The brave despair.
.ATTR Thomson
.QUOTE
'Tis not in mortals to command success; But we'll do more, Sempronius -- we'll
deserve it.
.ATTR Addison
.QUOTE
'Tis not the fairest form that holds The mildest, purest soul within; 'Tis not
the richest plant that holds The sweetest fragrance in.
.ATTR Dawes
.QUOTE
'Tis one thing to be tempted, another thing to fall.
.ATTR Shakespeare
.QUOTE
'Tis pleasant, sure, to see one's name in print; A book's a book, although
there's nothing in't.
.ATTR Lord Byron
.QUOTE
'Tis strange the miser should his cares employ To gain the riches he can ne'er
enjoy.
.ATTR Alexander Pope
.QUOTE
'Tis the mind that makes the body rich.
.ATTR Shakespeare
.QUOTE
(a) Completion of any task within the allocated time and budget does not bring
credit upon the performing personnel -- it merely proves the task was easier
than expected; (b) failure to complete any task within the allocated time and
budget proves the task was more difficult than expected and requires promotion
for those in charge.
.QUOTE
... brave thirst of fame his bosom warms.
.ATTR Winston Churchill
.QUOTE
... One sip of this will bathe the drooping spirits in delights beyond
dreams of bliss.
.QUOTE
... Survival demands collective action; "alone" is for gravestones in hacker's
cemeteries.
.QUOTE
... (concerning " marks) even if we DID quote anybody in this business, it
probably would be gibberish.
.ATTR Thom Mcleod
.QUOTE
... and borrowing dulls the edge of husbandry.
.ATTR Shakespeare
.QUOTE
... and living was just a way of passing time until he died.
.ATTR Hamish Sankov
.QUOTE
... and oftener changed their principles than their shirts.
.ATTR Dr. Young
.QUOTE
... cost consciousness and sophisticated design are basically incompatible.
.ATTR Richard F. Moore
.QUOTE
... high salaries equals happiness equals project success.
.ATTR Richard F. Moore
.QUOTE
... it is not through sin that he opposes God.   The Devil's strategy for our
times is to make trivial human existence and to isolate us from one another
while creating the delusion that the reasons are time pressures, work demands,
or economic anxieties.
.QUOTE
... persons who would be placed outside the pale of society with contempt are
not those who would be placed there by another culture.
.ATTR Ruth Benedict
.QUOTE
... that peculiar disease of intellectuals, that infatuation with ideas at the
expense of experience that compels experience to conform to bookish
preconceptions.
.QUOTE
... the less management demands of engineers and scientists, the greater their
productivity.
.ATTR Richard F. Moore
.QUOTE
... there being nothing more evident than that creatures of the same species
... should be equal amongst one another without subordination or subjection...
.ATTR John Locke
.QUOTE

.QUOTE
7:30, Channel 5:  The Bionic Dog (Action/Adventure). The Bionic Dog drinks too
much and kicks over the National Redwood Forest.
.QUOTE
7:30, Channel 5:  The Bionic Dog (Action/Adventure). The Bionic Dog gets a
hormonal short-circuit and violates the Mann Act with an interstate Greyhound
bus.
.QUOTE
8:30, Channel 7:  Bewitched. Tabitha gets carsick and turns Darin into a
plastic bag.
.QUOTE
9:00, Channel 5:  I Dream of Jeanie. Jeanie and Major Nelson discover new
things to do with Jeanie's bottle.
.QUOTE
90 percent of everything is crud.
.ATTR Theodore Sturgeon
.QUOTE
A "critic" is a person who creates nothing and thereby feels qualified to judge
the work of creative people.  There is logic in this; he is unbiased -- he
hates all creative people equally.
.ATTR Lazarus Long
.QUOTE
A "pacifist" is a contradiction in terms.  Most self-described pacifists are
not pacific; they simply assume false colors.  When the wind changes they hoist
the Jolly Roger.
.ATTR Lazarus Long
.QUOTE
A Democratic nation, at least when organized to secure the political rights of
life, liberty, and the pursuit of happiness, can be a large and populous
nation.
.ATTR Michael Scully
.QUOTE
A God alone can comprehend a God.
.ATTR Young
.QUOTE
A Smith and Wesson beats four aces.
.QUOTE
A White House well filled, a little peanut field well tilled, and a wife who
will go to the Bronx are great riches.
.ATTR Poor Jimmy's Almanac
.ATTR Napoleon Bonaparte
.QUOTE
A ball hitting a tree shall be deemed not to have hit the tree.  Hitting a tree
is simply bad luck and has no place in a scientific game.  The player should
estimate the distance the ball would have traveled if it had not hit the tree
and play the ball from there, preferably atop a nice firm tuft of grass.
.ATTR Donald A. Metz
.QUOTE
A ball sliced or hooked into the rough shall be lifted and placed in the
fairway at a point equal to the distance it carried or rolled into the rough.
Such veering right or left frequently results from friction between the face of
the club and the cover of the ball and the player should not be penalized for
the erratic behavior of the ball resulting from such uncontrollable physical
phenomena.
.ATTR Donald A. Metz
.QUOTE
A baseball player who makes a spectacular defensive play always leads off the
next inning as batter.
.ATTR Bob Smith
.QUOTE
A bathroom hook will be loaded to capacity immediately upon becoming available.
This also applies to freeways, closets, playgrounds, downtown hotels, taxis,
parking lots, bookcases, wallets, purses, pockets, pipe racks, basement
shelves, and so on.  The list is endless.
.ATTR John Joyce
.QUOTE
A beautiful eye makes silence eloquent, a kind eye makes contradiction an
assent, an enraged eye makes beauty deformed.  This little member gives life to
every part about us; and I believe the story of Argus implies no more, than the
eye is in every part; that is to say, every other part would be mutilated, were
not its force represented more by the eye than even by itself.
.ATTR Addison
.QUOTE
A bee is not a busier animal than a blockhead.
.ATTR Alexander Pope
.QUOTE
A bird in the hand is dead.
.ATTR Rhonda Boozer
.QUOTE
A bird in the hand is safer than two overhead.
.QUOTE
A bitter jest, when the satire comes too near the truth, leaves a sharp sting
behind.
.ATTR Tacitus
.QUOTE
A bottle of sweat for every bottle of wine.
.QUOTE
A brave man is sometimes a desperado; a bully is always a coward.
.ATTR Haliburton
.QUOTE
A brute kills for pleasure.  A fool kills from hate.
.QUOTE
A bureaucrat's castle is his desk ... and parking place.   Proceed cautiously
when changing either.
.ATTR Douglas Evelyn
.QUOTE
A camel looks like a horse that was planned by a committee.
.ATTR Vogue Magazine
.QUOTE
A carelessly planned project takes three times longer to complete than
expected; a carefully planned project will take only twice as long.
.QUOTE
A chain is only as strong as its weakest link.
.QUOTE
A characteristic of the normal child is he doesn't act that way very often.
.QUOTE
A chase always involves two parts:  First, breaking contact; second, the
retiring action to divorce oneself from the incident.
.ATTR Robert A. Heinlein
.QUOTE
A chicken doesn't stop scratching just because the worms are scarce.
.ATTR John Peers
.QUOTE
A child miseducated is a child lost.
.ATTR John F. Kennedy
.QUOTE
A Christian in this world is but gold in the ore; at death the pure gold is
melted out and separated and the dross cast away and consumed.
.ATTR Flavel
.QUOTE
A Christian is the highest style of man.
.ATTR Young
.QUOTE
A clean limerick is a contradiction in terms.
.QUOTE
A clown is a clown and will always be a clown.
.ATTR Babbaluche the cobbler
.QUOTE
A college education shows a man how little other people know.
.ATTR Haliburton
.QUOTE
A column about errors will contain errors.
.ATTR Bill Gold
.QUOTE
A committee is a life form with six or more legs and no brain.
.QUOTE
A committee is a thing which takes a week to do what one good man can do in an
hour.
.ATTR Elbert Hubbard
.QUOTE
A company is known by the people it keeps.
.QUOTE
A component's degree of reliability is directly proportional to its ease of
accessibility; i.e., the harder it is to get to, the more often it breaks down.
.ATTR Jonathan Waddell
.QUOTE
A compromise is the art of dividing the cake in such a way that each one
thinks he is getting the biggest piece.
.QUOTE
A consultant is an ordinary person a long way from home.
.QUOTE
A continuing flow of paper is sufficient to continue the flow of paper.
.ATTR John M. Dyer
.QUOTE
A coup that is known in advance is a coup that does not take place.
.QUOTE
A cow eats without a knife.
.QUOTE
A coward is a hero with a wife, kids, and a mortgage.
.ATTR Marvin Kitman
.QUOTE
A cynic is a man who knows the price of everything and the value of nothing.
.ATTR Oscar Wilde
.QUOTE
A cynic is a man who, when he smells flowers, looks around for a coffin.
.ATTR H. L. Mencken
.QUOTE
A cynic is a person searching for an honest man, with a stolen lantern.
.ATTR Edgar A. Shoaff
.QUOTE
A cynic is one who will laugh at anything so long as it isn't funny.
.QUOTE
A deaf ear is the first symptom of a closed mind.
.QUOTE
A diplomat and a stage magician are the two professions that have to have a

.QUOTE
A diplomat's life is made up of three things:  Protocol, Geritol, and alcohol.
.QUOTE
A disagreeable task is its own reward.
.QUOTE
A dress that zips up the back will bring a husband and wife together.
.ATTR James H. Boren
.QUOTE

.ATTR George Eliot
.QUOTE
A fail-safe circuit will destroy others.
.QUOTE

.ATTR Lazarus Long
.QUOTE
A falling body always rolls to the most inaccessible spot.
.ATTR Theodore M. Bernstein
.QUOTE
A fellow-feeling makes one wondrous kind.
.ATTR Garrick
.QUOTE
A few books are alright, like wine, but too much can be bad.  Books break down

.QUOTE
A fire eater must eat fire even if he has to kindle it himself.
.ATTR Salvor Hardin
.QUOTE

.ATTR Dr. Holland
.QUOTE
A five minutes before the hour, a student will ask a question requiring a ten

.ATTR M. M. Johnston
.QUOTE
A flattering painter, who made it his care to draw men as they ought to be, not

.ATTR Oliver Goldsmith
.QUOTE
A fool in high station is like a man on the top of a high mountain:  Everything

.ATTR Professor Leader W. Matsch
.QUOTE

.ATTR Crowne
.QUOTE
A foot is a device for finding furniture in the dark.
.QUOTE
A free people always has the right to dismiss its rulers -- whom it regards as

.ATTR Harry V. Jaffa
.QUOTE
A free society is one where it is safe to be unpopular.
.ATTR Adlai Stevenson
.QUOTE
A friend in need Is a friend indeed.
.QUOTE
A friend of mine stopped smoking, drinking, overeating, and chasing women --

.QUOTE
A friend to everybody is a friend to nobody.
.QUOTE
A friend will let you hold the ladder while he goes up on the roof to install

.QUOTE
A friend will refrain from telling you he picked up the same amount of life

.QUOTE
A gen'ral sets his army in array In vain, unless he fight and win the

.ATTR Denham
.QUOTE

.QUOTE

.ATTR Chesterfield
.QUOTE

.QUOTE
A gift of flowers will soon be made to you.
.QUOTE

.ATTR Milton
.QUOTE

.ATTR Else Schiaparelli
.QUOTE

.ATTR Doran
.QUOTE

.ATTR Voltaire
.QUOTE

.QUOTE
A good name will wear out; a bad one may be turned; a nickname lasts forever.
.ATTR Zimmerman
.QUOTE

.QUOTE
A good place to start is where you are.
.ATTR Charles Wolf, Jr.
.QUOTE

.ATTR Thomas J. Carruthers
.QUOTE

.ATTR Tillotson
.QUOTE
A goodly apple rotten at the heart; O, what a goodly outside falsehood hath!
.ATTR Shakespeare
.QUOTE
A grave, wherever found, preaches a short and pithy sermon to the soul.
.ATTR Hawthorne
.QUOTE

.QUOTE
A great fortune is a great slavery.
.ATTR Seneca
.QUOTE

.QUOTE

.ATTR Alexander Hamilton
.QUOTE

.QUOTE

.ATTR Lavater
.QUOTE
A heart unspotted is not easily daunted.
.ATTR Shakespeare
.QUOTE

.QUOTE

.QUOTE

.QUOTE

.ATTR Lao-Tse
.QUOTE

A little ignorance can go a long way.

.ATTR Poor Jimmy's Almanac

.ATTR Bacon
.QUOTE
"A loaf of bread," the Walrus said, "is what we chiefly need."
.QUOTE

.QUOTE

.ATTR Mead
.QUOTE
A man begins cutting his wisdom teeth the first time he bites off more than he

.ATTR Herb Caen
.QUOTE
A man convinced against his will is of the same opinion still.
.ATTR Butler
.QUOTE
A man devoid of religion is like a horse without a bridle.
.QUOTE
A man has no more right to say an uncivil thing, than to act one; no more right

A man he seems of cheerful yesterdays and confident tomorrows.
.ATTR Wordsworth
.QUOTE
A man is never astonished that he doesn't know what another does, but he is

.ATTR Haliburton
.QUOTE
A man must first govern himself ere he be fit to govern a family, and his

.ATTR Sir Walter Raleigh
.QUOTE
A man never discloses his own character so clearly as when he describes

.ATTR Jean Paul Richter
.QUOTE
A man said to the universe, "Sir, I exist." "However," replied the universe,

.QUOTE
A man should be careful never to tell tales of himself to his own disadvantage;

.ATTR Johnson
.QUOTE
A man should be greater than some of his parts.
.QUOTE
A man should choose a woman and an ox from his own country.
.QUOTE
A man should never be ashamed to own he has been in the wrong, which is but
saying, in other words, that he is wiser today than he was yesterday.
.ATTR Pope
.QUOTE
A man should not allow himself to hate even his enemies, because if you indulge
this passion on some occasions, it will rise of itself in others; if you hate

.ATTR Plutarch
.QUOTE
A man who can't mind his own business is not to be trusted with the king's.
.ATTR Saville
.QUOTE
A man who checks out of the express lane with seven items is the same man who
will wear Supp-Hose and park in the Reserved for Handicapped spaces.
.ATTR Erma Bombeck
.QUOTE
A man who cries is capable of any evil.
.QUOTE
A man who is always forgetting his best intentions may be said to be a thorough
fare of good resolutions.
.ATTR Mrs. Jameson
.QUOTE
A man who knows the world will not only make the most of everything he does
know, but of many things that he does not know; and will gain more credit by

.ATTR Colton
.QUOTE
A man who studieth revenge keeps his own wounds green.
.ATTR Francis Bacon
.QUOTE
A man who turns green has eschewed protein.
.QUOTE
A man with one watch knows what time it is; a man with two watches is never
sure.
.QUOTE
A man without a God is like a fish without a bicycle.
.QUOTE
A man without religion is like a fish without a bicycle.
.QUOTE
A man's dying is more the survivors' affair than his own.
.ATTR Thomas Mann
.QUOTE
A man's errors are what makes him amiable.
.ATTR Goethe
.QUOTE
A man's good breeding is the best security against another's bad manners.
.ATTR Chesterfield
.QUOTE
A man's legs must be long enough to reach the ground.
.ATTR Abraham Lincoln
.QUOTE

.QUOTE

A manuscript for a market in which no textbooks currently exist will be

.QUOTE
A meeting is a place where people get together to talk about what they should

.QUOTE
A memorandum is written not to inform the reader but to protect the writer.

.QUOTE
A military disaster may produce a better postwar situation than victory.
.ATTR Shimon Tzabar
.QUOTE
A mind content both crown and kingdom is.
.ATTR Greene
.QUOTE
A mother is a mother still, The holiest thing alive.
.ATTR Coleridge
.QUOTE
A motion to adjourn is always in order.
.QUOTE

.QUOTE

.QUOTE

.QUOTE

.ATTR Horace
.QUOTE

.ATTR Charlie Brower
.QUOTE

Work Rule:  After an employee has spent his 13 hours of labor in the office, he
should spend the remaining time reading the Bible and other good books.
.QUOTE
Work Rule:  Any employee who smokes Spanish cigars, uses liquor in any form, or
frequents pool and public halls, or gets shaved in a barber shop, will give me
good reasons to suspect his worth, intentions, integrity and honesty.
.QUOTE
Work Rule:  Death (Other Than Your Own) -- This is no excuse. If you can
arrange for funeral services to be held late in the afternoon, however, we can
let you off an hour early, provided all you work is up to date.
.QUOTE
Work Rule:  Each clerk will bring in a bucket of water and scuttle of coal for
the day's business.
.QUOTE
Work Rule:  Each day fill lamps, clean chimneys, and trim wicks. Wash the
windows once a week.
.QUOTE
Work Rule:  Entirely too much time is being spent in the washrooms. In the
future, you will follow the practice of going in alphabetical order.  For
instance, those whose surnames begin with "A" will be allowed to go from 9 -
9:05 AM, and so on.  If you are unable to go at your appointed time, it will be
necessary to wait until the next day when your time comes around again.
.QUOTE
Work Rule:  Every employee should lay aside from each pay a goodly sum of his
earnings for his benefit during his declining years, so that he will not become
a burden on society or his betters.
.QUOTE
Work Rule:  Leave of Absence (for an Operation) -- We are no longer allowing
this practice.  We wish to discourage any thoughts that you may not need all of
whatever you have, and you should not consider having anything removed.  We
hired you as you are, and to have anything removed would certainly make you
less than we bargained for.
.QUOTE
Work Rule:  Make your pens carefully. You may whittle nibs to your individual
taste.
.QUOTE
Work Rule:  Men employees will be given off each week for courting purposes, or
two evenings a week if they go regularly to church.
.QUOTE
Work Rule:  Office employees will daily sweep the floors, dust the furniture,
shelves, and showcases.
.QUOTE
Work Rule:  Sickness -- No excuses will be acceptable. We will no longer accept
your doctor's statement as proof of illness, as we believe that if you are able
to go to the doctor, you are able to come to work.
.QUOTE
Work Rule:  The employee who has performed his labors faithfully and without a
fault for five years, will be given an increase of five cents per day in his
pay, providing profits from the business permit it.
.QUOTE
Work Rule:  This office will open at 7:00 AM and close at 8:00 PM except on the
Sabbath, on which day we will remain closed.  Each employee is expected to
spend the Sabbath by attending church and contributing liberally to the cause
of the Lord.

.QUOTE
Yeccchhh!  That must be a face, it has ears!
.QUOTE
Yesterday I was on a guilt trip ... today I'm on an ego trip.
.QUOTE
Yet I argue not Against heaven's hand or will, nor bate a jot Of heart or hope,
but still bear up and steer Right onward.
.ATTR Milton
.QUOTE
Yield to temptation; it may not pass your way again.
.ATTR Lazarus Long
.QUOTE
Yippies, hippies, yahoos, Black Panthers, lions and tigers alike -- I would
swap the whole damn zoo for the kind of young Americans I saw in Vietnam.
.ATTR Spiro Agnew
.QUOTE
You always find something in the last place you look.
.QUOTE
You amass things only to enjoy them.
.QUOTE
You are a bundle of energy always on the go.
.QUOTE
You are a pioneer type and hold most people in contempt.
.QUOTE
You are a quick and intelligent thinker.
.QUOTE
You are almost there.
.QUOTE
You are always busy.
.QUOTE
You are aware that merit is not always rewarded.
.QUOTE
You are building up credit for the future.
.QUOTE
You are capable of planning your future.
.QUOTE
You are certainly entitled to your opinion.  Fortunately, the rest of us are
entitled to ignore it.
.QUOTE
You are conservative and afraid of taking risks.
.QUOTE
You are cordially invited to go screw yourself.
.QUOTE
You are deeply attached to your friends and acquaintances.
.QUOTE
You are dishonest, but never to the point of hurting a friend.
.QUOTE
You are fairminded, just and loving.
.QUOTE
You are farsighted, a good planner, an ardent lover, and a faithful friend.
.QUOTE
You are free and that is why you are lost.
.ATTR Franz Kafka
.QUOTE
You are going to have a new love affair (with a rock).
.QUOTE
You are going to have a new love affair.
.QUOTE
You are heading for a land of sunshine.  But you're not all there.
.QUOTE
You are inclined to be careless and impractical, causing you to make the same
mistakes repeatedly.
.QUOTE
You are logical and hate disorder.
.QUOTE
You are magnetic in your bearing.
.QUOTE
You are not worth the dust which the rude wind blows in your face.
.ATTR Shakespeare
.QUOTE
You are nuts.
.QUOTE
You are optimistic and intelligent.
.QUOTE
You are quick tempered, impatient, and scornful of advice.
.QUOTE
You are scrupulously honest, frank, and straightforward.
.QUOTE
You are secretive in your dealings but never to the extent of trickery.
.QUOTE
You are sensitive to the atmosphere around you.
.QUOTE
You are shrewd in business and cannot be trusted.
.QUOTE
You are standing on my toes.
.QUOTE
You are strong enough to admit that you need help.
.QUOTE
You are such a good salesman, you could sell a double bed to the Pope.
.QUOTE
You are sympathetic and understanding to other people's problems.  They think
you are a sucker.
.QUOTE
You are tricky, but never to the point of dishonesty.
.QUOTE
You believe that you are the master of your fate; the captain of your soul.
.QUOTE
You can choose a ready guide in some celestial voice; if you choose not to
decide you still have made a choice.  You can choose from phantom fears or
kindness that could kill; I will choose a path that's clear:  I will choose
free will.
.ATTR Rush
.QUOTE
You can do very well in speculation where land or anything to do with earth is
concerned.
.QUOTE
You can fool all of the people all of the time, but why bother when all you
need is a simple majority?
.QUOTE
You can fool the people about many things, but only a fool would be foolish
enough to fool the people about money.
.ATTR Italo Bombolini
.QUOTE
You can get anywhere in ten minutes if you go fast enough.
.QUOTE
You can go wrong by being too skeptical as readily as by being too trusting.
.QUOTE
You can have peace.  Or you can have freedom.  Never count on having both at
once.
.QUOTE
You can judge a leader by the size of the problems he tackles -- people nearly
always pick a problem their own size, and ignore or leave to others the bigger
of smaller ones.
.ATTR Anthony Jay
.QUOTE
You can lead a horse to water, but if you can get him to float on his back
you've got something.
.QUOTE
You can lead a horticulture, but you can't make her think.
.ATTR Dorothy Parker
.QUOTE
You can lead a whore to Vasser, but you can't make her think.
.ATTR Frederick B. Artz
.QUOTE
You can learn many things from children.  How much patience you have, for
instance.
.ATTR Franklin P. Jones
.QUOTE
You can never do merely one thing.
.ATTR Garrett Hardin
.QUOTE
You can observe a lot just by watching.
.ATTR Yogi Berra
.QUOTE
You can only get three fingers in a bowling ball.
.QUOTE
You can only govern men by serving them.  The rule is without exception.
.ATTR Victor Cousin
.QUOTE
You can tell when you're on the right track -- it's usually uphill.
.QUOTE
You can't break even.
.QUOTE
You can't even quit the game.
.QUOTE
You can't expect to hit the jackpot if you don't put a few nickels in the
machine.
.ATTR Flip Wilson
.QUOTE
You can't guard against the arbitrary.
.QUOTE
You can't tell how deep a puddle is until you step into it.
.QUOTE
You can't trust a man who won't shave himself on his own hangover.
.QUOTE
You can't win.
.QUOTE
You cannot antagonize and persuade at the same time.
.QUOTE
You cannot bring about prosperity by discouraging thrift.
.QUOTE
You cannot build character and courage by taking away a man's initiative and
independence.
.QUOTE
You cannot discover working programs.  You can only discover them broken.
.QUOTE
You cannot establish sound social security on borrowed money.
.QUOTE
You cannot further the brotherhood of man by inciting class hatred.
.QUOTE
You cannot help men permanently by doing for them what they could and should do
for themselves.
.QUOTE
You cannot help small men up by tearing down big men.
.QUOTE
You cannot help the poor by destroying the rich.
.QUOTE
You cannot keep out of trouble by spending more than your income.
.QUOTE
You cannot kill time without injuring eternity.
.QUOTE
You cannot lift the wage-earner up by pulling the wage-payer down.
.QUOTE
You cannot propel yourself forward by patting yourself on the back.
.QUOTE
You cannot strengthen the weak by weakening the strong.
.QUOTE
You cannot successfully determine beforehand which side of the bread to butter.
.QUOTE
You compensate for you prejudices when making decisions.
.QUOTE
You compromise on what you shouldn't and fight for things not worth fighting
for.
.QUOTE
You consider yourself a born leader.  Others think of you as pushy.
.QUOTE
You display the wonderful traits of charm and courtesy.
.QUOTE
You don't drink beer.  You rent it.
.QUOTE
You don't learn anything the second time you're kicked by a mule.
.QUOTE
You don't need to fly to have more fun with wings.
.ATTR Joe Anderson
.QUOTE
You enjoy the company of other people.
.QUOTE
You feel strong enough to be gentle.
.QUOTE
You freely express resentment at bad treatment.  Then you forget it.
.QUOTE
You get the most of what you need the least.
.ATTR Jane Bryant Quinn
.QUOTE
You goddamn cornhuskers are all alike.
.ATTR Jim Thompson
.QUOTE
You grow up the day you have the first real laugh -- at yourself.
.QUOTE
You have a deep appreciation of the arts and music.
.QUOTE
You have a difficult time coping with reality.
.QUOTE
You have a healthy appreciation of your abilities, and a keen awareness of your
limitations.
.QUOTE
You have a reckless tendency to rely on luck since you lack talent.
.QUOTE
You have a reputation for being thoroughly reliable and trustworthy.
.QUOTE
You have a reputation for being thoroughly unreliable and untrustworthy.
.QUOTE
You have a strong appeal for members of the opposite sex.
.QUOTE
You have a strong desire for a home and your family interests come first.
.QUOTE
You have a truly strong individuality.
.QUOTE
You have a vivid imagination and often think you are being followed by the CIA
and FBI.
.QUOTE
You have a vivid imagination and often think you are being followed by the CIA
and FBI.  (You are!)
.QUOTE
You have a will that can be influenced by all with whom you come in contact.
.QUOTE
You have an ability to sense and know higher truth.
.QUOTE
You have an ambitious nature and may make a name for yourself.
.QUOTE
You have an inventive mind and are inclined to be progressive.
.QUOTE
You have an unusual equipment for success.  Be sure to use it properly.
.QUOTE
You have an unusual understanding of the problems of human relationship.
.QUOTE
You have been selected for a secret mission.
.QUOTE
You have had a long-term stimulation relative to business.
.QUOTE
You have literary talent that you should take pains to develop.
.QUOTE
You have many dear and loyal friends.
.QUOTE
You have many friends and very few enemies.
.QUOTE
You have minor influence over your associates and people resent you for
flaunting your powers.
.QUOTE
You have more respect for a capable shoeshine boy, than for a crass
opportunist.
.QUOTE
You have no friends among the ambitious.
.ATTR Ron Randall
.QUOTE
You have taken yourself too seriously.
.QUOTE
You have the body of a 19 year old.  Please return it before it gets wrinkled.
.QUOTE
You have the power to influence all with whom you come in contact.
.QUOTE
You have to be as fully prepared for the dull game as you are for the great
game, or else you won't be prepared for the great one.
.ATTR Red Barber
.QUOTE
You hear about constitutional rights, free speech and the free press.  Every
time I hear these words I say to myself, "That man is a Red!" ...  You never
hear a REAL American talk like that!
.ATTR Mayor Frank Hague
.QUOTE
You judge others only by how well they live up to their own capacities.
.QUOTE
You judge the acts of others only by their intentions.
.QUOTE
You judge your own acts only by their consequences.
.QUOTE
You keep your equilibrium no matter what position you find yourself in.
.QUOTE
You know it's going to be a bad day when:  you call suicide prevention and they
put you on hold.
.QUOTE
You know it's going to be a bad day when:  you see a "60 Minutes" news team
waiting in your office.
.QUOTE
You know it's going to be a bad day when:  you turn on the news and they're
displaying emergency routes out of your city.
.QUOTE
You know it's going to be a bad day when:  you wake up face down on the
pavement.
.QUOTE
You know it's going to be a bad day when:  you want to put on the clothes you
wore home from the party and there aren't any.
.QUOTE
You know it's going to be a bad day when:  your birthday cake collapses from
the weight of the candles.
.QUOTE
You know it's going to be a bad day when:  your horn goes off accidentally and
remains stuck as you follow a group of Hell's Angels on the freeway.
.QUOTE
You know it's going to be a bad day when:  your only son tells you he wishes
Anita Bryant would mind her own business.
.QUOTE
You know it's going to be a bad day when:  your twin sister forgets your
birthday.
.QUOTE
You know that people will be kind to you, given a chance.
.QUOTE
You know what to fight for and what to compromise on.
.QUOTE
You know when the price of winning is too high.
.QUOTE
You know you're paranoid when you can't think of anything that's your fault.
.ATTR Robert Hutchins
.QUOTE
You lack confidence and are generally a coward.
.QUOTE
You learn from your mistakes.
.QUOTE
You left your footprints on my stomach when you walked out of my heart.
.QUOTE
You like to form new friendships and make new acquaintances.
.QUOTE
You live and learn.  Or you don't live long.
.QUOTE
You love peace.
.QUOTE
You love your home and want it to be beautiful.
.QUOTE
You may be sure that when a man begins to call himself a "realist," he is
preparing to do something he is secretly ashamed of doing.
.ATTR Sydney Harris
.QUOTE
You may not be able to change the whole world, but at least you can embarrass
the guilty.
.ATTR Katha Pollitt
.QUOTE
You need not worry about your future.
.QUOTE
You never hesitate to tackle the most difficult problems.
.QUOTE
You never know where bottom is until you plumb for it.
.ATTR Frederick Laing
.QUOTE
You own a dog; you feed a cat.
.QUOTE
You plan things that you do not even attempt because of your extreme caution.
.QUOTE
You prefer the company of the opposite sex, but are well liked by your own.
.QUOTE
You recoil from the crude; you tend naturally toward the exquisite.
.QUOTE
You respect those superior to yourself and try to learn from them.
.QUOTE
You say it can't be won The way the game is run; But if you choose to stay You
wind up playin' anyway.
.ATTR Jackson Browne
.QUOTE
You seek to shield those you love and you like the role of the provider.
.QUOTE
You shall be rewarded for a dastardly deed.
.QUOTE
You shall reach the pinnacle of success because of your total lack of ethics.
.QUOTE
You think it is a want of judgment that he changes his opinion.  Do you think
it a proof that your scales are bad because they vibrate with every additional
weight that is added to either side?
.ATTR Edgeworth
.QUOTE
You try never to hurt people, and do so only when it serves a higher purpose.
.QUOTE
You will always have good luck in your personal affairs.
.QUOTE
You will attract cultured and artistic people to your home.
.QUOTE
You will be aided greatly by a person whom you thought to be unimportant.
.QUOTE
You will be awarded a medal for disregarding safety in saving someone.
.QUOTE
You will be awarded some great honor.
.QUOTE
You will be called upon to help a friend in trouble.
.QUOTE
You will be given a post of trust and responsibility.
.QUOTE
You will be honored for contributing your time and skill to a worthy cause.
.QUOTE
You will be married within a year.
.QUOTE
You will be recognized and honored as a community leader.
.QUOTE
You will be shot at sunrise.
.QUOTE
You will be singled out for promotion in your work.
.QUOTE
You will be successful in love.
.QUOTE
You will be surprised by a loud noise.
.QUOTE
You will be surrounded by luxury.
.QUOTE
You will be traveling and coming into a fortune.
.QUOTE
You will emerge from the gutter, only to trip and land in the sewer.
.QUOTE
You will engage in a profitable business activity.
.QUOTE
You will gain money by a speculation or lottery.
.QUOTE
You will have good luck and overcome many hardships.
.QUOTE
You will have long and healthy life.
.QUOTE
You will hear good news from one you thought unfriendly to you.
.QUOTE
You will inherit some money or a small piece of land.
.QUOTE
You will meet an important person who will help you advance professionally.
.QUOTE
You will need three umbrellas:  one to leave at the office, one to leave at
home home, and one to leave on the train.
.ATTR James L. Blankenship
.QUOTE
You will never know hunger.
.QUOTE
You will overcome the attacks of jealous associates.
.QUOTE
You will probably marry after a very brief courtship.
.QUOTE
You will receive a legacy which will place you above want.
.QUOTE
You will soon meet a person who will play an important role in your life.
.QUOTE
You will step on the soil of many countries.
.QUOTE
You will triumph over your enemy.
.QUOTE
You will win success in whatever calling you adopt.
.QUOTE
You win a few, you lose a few.  But I wish this one had been rained out.
.QUOTE
You would rather be admired than liked, although you would prefer both.
.QUOTE
You would rather blame yourself than others, but you don't waste much time
doing either when things go wrong.
.QUOTE
You'll find in no park or city A monument to a committee.
.ATTR Victoria Pasternak
.QUOTE
You're not drunk if you can lie on the floor without holding on.
.ATTR Dean Martin
.QUOTE
You're not my type.  For that matter, you're not even my species!!!
.QUOTE
Your If is the only peace-maker -- much virtue in If.
.ATTR Shakespeare
.QUOTE
Your aims are high, and you are capable of much.
.QUOTE
Your business will assume vast proportions.
.QUOTE
Your dentist will buy a yacht.
.QUOTE
Your depth of comprehension may tend to make you lax in worldly ways.
.QUOTE
Your domestic life may be harmonious.
.QUOTE
Your gift is princely, but it comes too late, And falls like sunbeams on a
blasted blossom.
.ATTR Suckling
.QUOTE
Your happiness is intertwined with your outlook on life.
.QUOTE
Your heart is pure, and your mind clear, and your soul devout.
.QUOTE
Your love life will be happy and harmonious.
.QUOTE
Your lover will never wish to leave you.
.QUOTE
Your mental health will be better if you have lots of fun outside of that
office.
.ATTR Dr. William Menninger
.QUOTE
Your mind understands what you have been taught; your heart, what is true.
.QUOTE
Your mode of life will be changed for the better because of good news soon.
.QUOTE
Your mode of life will be changed for the better because of new developments.
.QUOTE
Your nature demands love and your happiness depends on it.
.QUOTE
Your own qualities will help prevent your advancement in the world.
.QUOTE
Your present plans will be successful.
.QUOTE
Your reasoning powers are good, and you are a fairly good planner.
.QUOTE
Your rich uncle will die, but will spell your name incorrectly.
.QUOTE
Your society will be sought by people of taste and refinement.
.QUOTE
Your talents will be recognized and suitably rewarded.
.QUOTE
Your temporary financial embarrassment will be relieved in a surprising manner.
.QUOTE
Youth had been a habit of hers so long that she could not part with it.
.QUOTE
Zero raised to the nth power remains zero.
.ATTR Pop Baslim
.QUOTE
Zoo:  An excellent place to study the habits of human beings.
.ATTR Evan Esar

PELISTR5.text:
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
*        FREEWARE: THIS PROGRAM IS DISTRIBUTED ON AN AS-IS BASIS
*                  WITHOUT WARRANTY, EITHER EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, BY:
*
*                  THE NATIONAL SYSTEMS PROGRAMMERS ASSOCIATION (NASPA)
*                  P.O. BOX 21525
*                  MILWAUKEE, WI 53221
*
*   - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
*
*        PROGRAM WRITTEN BY:
*
*                  MICHAEL GEARING
*                  PORTLAND, OR
*
* - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
*
*        MODIFIED MARCH 1988
*                 BY R.B.VIPOND
*                    BALCOR/AMERICAN EXPRESS
*                    4849 GOLF ROAD
*                    SKOKIE, IL.   60077
*                    (312)677-2900
*
*          IN AN ATTEMPT TO REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF MANUAL
*          INTERVENTION AND CHECKING THAT HAD TO BE DONE
*          AND DECISIONS THAT HAD TO BE MADE, THE FOLLOWING
*          CHANGES HAVE BE INCORPORATED INTO THIS PROGRAM:
*
*            INCLUDED ACTION TO BE TAKEN MESSAGE ON REPORT.
*
*            INCLUDED CORRECTING PTF NUMBER ON REPORT IF IT
*            WAS ON THE SYSTEM.
*
*            EXCLUDED PE'D PTF'S THAT HAD ALREADY BEEN SUP'D
*            BY ANOTHER PTF.
*
*            CHANGED NAME FROM HOLDPGM TO PELIST.
*
*
*        MODIFIED MARCH 1989
*                 BY R.B.VIPOND
*                    BALCOR/AMERICAN EXPRESS
*                    4849 GOLF ROAD
*                    SKOKIE, IL.   60077
*                    (312)677-2900
*
*            SUGGESTED BY: DON WEIMER
*          SUPPRESSED SUPERSEDED PTF MESSAGES SINCE THEY HAVE
*          NO ACTION TO BE TAKEN AND ARE ONLY FOR INFORMATION
*          PURPOSES.
*
*
*        MODIFIED FEBRUARY 1991
*                 BY KEVIN L. WILLIAMS
*                    MEIJER, INC., 982/2
*                    2727 WALKER AVE NW
*                    GRAND RAPIDS, MI  49504
*                    (616) 791-3621
*
*          CONVERTED TO SMP/E RELEASE 5 FORMAT AND CHANGED
*          THE NAME FROM PELIST TO PELISTR5.
*
*          ADDED CODE TO OPTIONALLY SHOW SUPD PE PTFS.
*
*          ELIMINATED INFORMATIONAL WTOS
*
*          ELIMINATED NEED FOR WRKDISK AND DISKIN.
*
*
*   - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
*
*     PROGRAM INPUT:
*        ,PARM=(TTTTTTT,DDDDDDD{,S})
*                       -  TARGET ZONE NAME, DLIB ZONE NAME,
*                          (OPTIONALLY) SHOW SUPD PE PTFS
*        GLBLCSI        -  GLOBAL CSI
*        TARGCSI        -  TARGET CSI
*        DLIBCSI        -  DLIB CSI
*
*     PROGRAM OUTPUT:
*        REPORT         -  PE LIST WITH ACTION TO BE TAKEN
*
*   - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
*
*     COMPILE AND EXECUTION JCL SAMPLES:
*
* //PROC1    EXEC ASMHCL,REGION.C=4096K,REGION.L=4096K,
* //  PARM.L='LIST,LET,NCAL,XREF,SIZE=(384K,96K)'
* //C.SYSLIB DD  DSN=TECH.NASPA.MACLIB,DISP=SHR
* //         DD  DSN=SYS1.MACLIB,DISP=SHR
* //         DD  DSN=SYS1.AMODGEN,DISP=SHR
* //C.SYSIN  DD  DSN=TECH.SMPE.SOURCE(PELISTR5),DISP=SHR
* //L.SYSLMOD DD  DSN=TBCT.LINKLIB,DISP=SHR
* //L.SYSIN  DD  DSN=TECH.NASPA.LINKDATA(PELISTR5),DISP=SHR
*
*   - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
*
* //STEP1    EXEC PGM=PELISTR5,PARM=(MVST,MVSD,S)
* //STEPLIB  DD  DSN=TBCT.LINKLIB,DISP=SHR
* //GLBLCSI  DD  DSN=GLOBAL.CSI,DISP=SHR
* //TARGCSI  DD  DSN=MVST.CSI,DISP=SHR
* //DLIBCSI  DD  DSN=MVSD.CSI,DISP=SHR
* //REPORT   DD  SYSOUT=*
*
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
         EJECT
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
*     THIS PROGRAM HAS MET A BASIC SET OF PROGRAMMING AND
*     DOCUMENTATION STANDARDS, BUT HAS NOT BEEN PROGRAM TESTED IN ANY
*     FORMAL FASHION BY NASPA. THE USER IS EXPECTED TO MAKE THE FINAL
*     EVALUATION OF THE USE OF THIS PROGRAM IN THEIR ENVIRONMENT.
*
*     NASPA MAKES NO WARRANTY, EXPRESSED OR IMPLIED, OF THE FITNESS
*     FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AS RELATES TO THE DOCUMENTATION,
*     FUNCTION, RESULTS, OR PERFORMANCE OF THIS PROGRAM.
*
*     IMPLEMENTATION AND USE OF THIS PROGRAM CONSTITUTES A RELEASE
*     FROM LIABILITY OF NASPA FOR ANY PROBLEMS ARISING FROM THE USE OF
*     THIS PROGRAM AT THE USER'S INSTALLATION.
*
*     THIS PROGRAM IS MADE AVAILABLE BY NASPA WITHOUT CHARGE.
*     RECIPIENTS ARE FREE TO MAKE THIS PROGRAM AVAILABLE TO OTHERS IN
*     LIKE MANNER, PROVIDED THIS DISCLAIMER IS KEPT INTACT.  IT MAY
*     NOT BE SOLD, TRADED, OR EXCHANGED FOR CASH, SERVICES, OR AS AN
*     INCENTIVE FOR SERVICES AND/OR OTHER PURCHASES, NOR MAY IT BE
*     INTEGRATED INTO ANY PROGRAM FOR SUCH USE.
*
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
         EJECT
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
*        FIND  PTFS THAT HAVE BEEN APPLIED THAT ARE IN ERROR
*
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
PELISTR5 #SLC  R12
         EJECT
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        PROCESS INPUT PARM
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
         L     R3,0(R1)                POINT TO PASSED PARAMETER
         LH    R4,0(R3)                PARAMETER LENGTH
         LA    R3,2(R3)                POINT PAST PARM LENGTH
*
         LA    R15,TZONAME             TARGET ZONE NAME
CHKTNAME CLI   0(R3),C','              END OF TARGET ZONE NAME?
         BE    ENDTNAME                YES -> GET DLIB ZONE
         MVC   0(1,R15),0(R3)          MOVE ONE CHAR OF TZONE NAME
         LA    R15,1(R15)              NEXT OUTPUT POSITION
         LA    R3,1(R3)                NEXT INPUT POSITION
         BCT   R4,CHKTNAME             DO NEXT CHARACTER
         B     BADPARM                 NO COMMA -> PARM ERROR
ENDTNAME LA    R3,1(R3)                SKIP COMMA
         BCT   R4,DNAME                DECREMENT PARAMETER LENGTH
         B     BADPARM                 NO DLIB ZONE IN PARM
*
DNAME    LA    R15,DZONAME             DLIB ZONE NAME
CHKDNAME CLI   0(R3),C','              END OF DLIB ZONE NAME?
         BE    ENDDNAME                YES -> CHECK FOR ",S"
         MVC   0(1,R15),0(R3)          MOVE ONE CHAR OF TZONE NAME
         LA    R15,1(R15)              NEXT OUTPUT POSITION
         LA    R3,1(R3)                NEXT INPUT POSITION
         BCT   R4,CHKDNAME             DO NEXT CHARACTER
         B     ZONEOPEN                NO OTHER PARAMTER
ENDDNAME LA    R3,1(R3)                SKIP COMMA
         BCT   R4,PARM3                DECREMENT PARAMETER LENGTH
         B     BADPARM                 COMMA BUT NO THIRD PARM
PARM3    MVC   SHOWSUPD,0(R3)          SAVE THIRD PARM
         B     ZONEOPEN
*
BADPARM  WTO   'INVALID PARM - MUST SPECIFY TARGET ZONE, DLIB ZONE, AND+
                (OPTIONALLY) "S" TO SHOW SUPD PE PTFS',ROUTCDE=(11)
         B     STOP2
*
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        OPEN THE GLOBAL, TARGET, AND DLIB ZONE CSIS
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
ZONEOPEN OPEN  (GLBLCSI,(INPUT),TARGCSI,(INPUT),DLIBCSI,(INPUT))
         LTR   R15,R15                 GOOD OPEN?
         BNZ   ERROR                   NO -> ABEND
         EJECT
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        FIND THE TARGET ZONE RECORD THAT HAS A HEX NUMBER IN IT THAT
*        IS USED AS PART OF THE KEY TO THAT TARGET ZONE.
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
FINDTZ   GET   RPL=TARGSEQ             GET A RECORD
         LTR   R15,R15                 DID WE GET ONE?
         BNZ   ERROR                   NO -> GET OUT
         CLC   TARGETZ,ZONE02          PAST ZONE RECORDS?
         BNH   FINDTZ2                 NO -> WE'RE OK
         WTO   'THERE IS NO TARGET ZONE TO MATCH THE INPUT PARM',      +
               ROUTCDE=(11)
         B     STOP2
FINDTZ2  CLC   TZONAME,TARGETS         REQUESTED ZONE NAME?
         BNE   FINDTZ                  NO -> KEEP LOOKING
         MVC   TZONKEY,TARGETH         SAVE ZONE KEY
         MVC   TARGHEX,TZONKEY         MOVE ZONE HEX TO TARGET
         EJECT
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        FIND THE DLIB ZONE RECORD THAT HAS A HEX NUMBER IN IT THAT
*        IS USED AS PART OF THE KEY TO THAT DLIB ZONE.
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
FINDDZ   GET   RPL=DLIBSEQ             GET A RECORD
         LTR   R15,R15                 DID WE GET ONE?
         BNZ   ERROR                   NO -> GET OUT
         CLC   DLIBZ,ZONE02            PAST ZONE RECORDS?
         BNH   FINDDZ2                 NO -> WE'RE OK
         WTO   'THERE IS NO DLIB ZONE TO MATCH THE INPUT PARM',        +
               ROUTCDE=(11)
         B     STOP2
FINDDZ2  CLC   DZONAME,DLIBS           COMPARE THE ZONE NAMES
         BNE   FINDDZ                  NOT THE ONE WE WANT
         MVC   DZONKEY,DLIBH           SAVE ZONE KEY
         MVC   DLIBHEX,DZONKEY         MOVE ZONE HEX TO DLIB
         EJECT
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        GETMAIN STORAGE TO STORE PE PTF AND FIXING APAR INFORMATION.
*        THIS INFORMATION USED TO BE WRITTEN TO A TEMPORARY FILE
*        ON DASD.  REQUEST STORAGE TO STORE AT LEAST 10 AND UP TO
*        100,000 PE PTFS.
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
         GETMAIN VRC,LV=(14*100000,14*10)
         STM   R0,R1,WRKSIZE           SAVE STORAGE SIZE AND ADDRESS
         LR    R5,R1                   CURRENT RECORD POINTER
         USING WRKAREA,R5              MAP THE DSECT
         SLR   R6,R6                   INITIALIZE NUMBER OF PE PTFS
*
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        POSITION OURSELVES INTO THE GLOBAL ZONE AT THE FIRST
*        GLOBAL ZONE SYSMOD RECORD.
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
SETUP    POINT RPL=GLBLSEQ             POINT TO SYSMOD RECORDS
         LTR   R15,R15                 OK?
         BNZ   ERROR                   NO -> ERROR
*
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        LOOK AT EACH GLOBAL ZONE SYSMOD RECORD TO SEE IF IT IS A
*        HOLD TYPE SYSMOD.
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
READGLB  GET   RPL=GLBLSEQ             GET A RECORD
         LTR   R15,R15                 GOT IT?
         BNZ   ERROR                   NO -> ERROR
         CLC   GLOBALK,ZONE6F          LAST GLOBAL SYSMOD RECORD?
         BNE   SETEOF                  YES -> WE'RE DONE HERE
         CLC   GLOBALF,TYPE2210        HOLDERROR TYPE SYSMOD RECORD?
         BNE   READGLB                 NO -> KEEP LOOKING
*
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        ONCE WE HAVE A SYSMOD WITH HOLDERROR.  SEE IF IT IS
*        APPLIED IN OUR TARGET ZONE.
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
         MVC   TARGSYS,GLOBALP         MOVE HOLD PTF
         GET   RPL=TARGDIR             SEE IF IT IS IN THE TZONE
         LTR   R15,R15                 FIND IT?
         BNZ   READGLB                 NO -> OK
*
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        JUST BECAUSE THE HELD PTF IS APPLIED DOESN'T MEAN IT IS
*        ON IN ERROR. THE APAR NUMBER THAT THE PTF IS BEING HELD
*        FOR MAY HAVE BEEN VALIDLY SUPERSEDED BY ANOTHER PTF.
*        TO CHECK THIS OUT, SEE IF THE APAR IN ERROR IS APPLIED
*        IN OUR TZONE.  IF IT IS NOT, THEN WE KNOW THAT THE HELD
*        PTF IS ON IN ERROR.
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
         MVC   TARGSYS,GLOBALE         MOVE ERROR APAR
         GET   RPL=TARGDIR             SEE IF IT IS ON
         LTR   R15,R15                 IS THE ERROR APAR IN THE TZONE?
         BZ    READGLB                 YES -> THEN IT IS SUPERSEDED
*
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        WE NOW KNOW THAT WE HAVE A PE PTF APPLIED IN OUR TARGET
*        ZONE (THOUGH THE PTF COULD STILL BE SUPD).  SAVE THE
*        PE PTF AND FIXING APAR IN A TABLE FOR FUTURE PROCESSING.
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
         MVC   WRKS,GLOBALP            PTF IN ERROR
         MVC   WRKE,GLOBALE            FIXING APAR
         LA    R5,WRKLEN(R5)           NEXT SLOT IN STORAGE
         LA    R6,1(R6)                BUMP PE PTF COUNTER
         B     READGLB                 GET NEXT RECORD
         EJECT
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        CLOSE AND REOPEN THE GLOBAL, TARGET AND DLIB ZONE CSIS
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
SETEOF   MVI   EOFSW,C'Y'              VALID EOF REACHED
         CLOSE (GLBLCSI,,TARGCSI,,DLIBCSI)
         LTR   R15,R15                 GOOD CLOSE ?
         BNZ   ERROR                   NO -> ABEND
         OPEN  (GLBLCSI,(INPUT),TARGCSI,(INPUT),DLIBCSI,(INPUT),       +
               REPORT,(OUTPUT))
         LTR   R15,R15                 GOOD OPEN?
         BNZ   ERROR                   NO -> ABEND
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
         MVC   REPRTS,=C'  P E  '
         MVC   REPRTE,=C'A P A R'
         MVC   REPRTF,=C' F I X '
         MVC   REPRTM,=C'ACTION TO BE TAKEN                      '
         PUT   REPORT,REPRT            WRITE A LINE
         MVC   REPRTS,=C'-------'
         MVC   REPRTE,=C'-------'
         MVC   REPRTF,=C'-------'
         MVC   REPRTM,=C'----------------------------------------'
         PUT   REPORT,REPRT            WRITE A LINE
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
         MVI   TARGHEX-1,X'00'         SETUP TARGET KEY FOR
         MVC   TARGHEX,TZONKEY           SYSMOD RECORDS
         MVI   TARGHEX+1,X'6F'
         MVI   TARGHEX+2,X'00'
*
         MVI   SUPDHEX-1,X'00'         SETUP TARGET KEY FOR
         MVC   SUPDHEX,DZONKEY           SYSMOD SUPBY RECORDS
         MVI   SUPDHEX+1,X'6F'
         MVI   SUPDHEX+2,X'00'
         MVI   SUPDPE+7,C' '
         MVC   SUPDPE+8,=X'01700000'
*
         MVI   DLIBHEX-1,X'00'         SETUP DLIB KEY FOR
         MVC   DLIBHEX,DZONKEY           SYSMOD RECORDS
         MVI   DLIBHEX+1,X'6F'
         MVI   DLIBHEX+2,X'00'
*
         L     R5,WRKADDR              POINT TO FIRST PE PTF IN STORAGE
         B     DOPTF                   SKIP TABLE POINTER BUMP CODE
         EJECT
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        PROCESS EACH PE PTF
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
NEXTPTF  LA    R5,WRKLEN(R5)           POINT TO NEXT PE PTF
         BCTR  R6,0                    DECREMENT COUNTER
DOPTF    CLI   EOFSW,C'N'              VALID EOF REACHED?
         BE    STOP                    NO -> GET OUT
         LTR   R6,R6                   ANY MORE PE PTFS?
         BZ    STOP                    NO - > GET OUT
         MVC   REPRTS,WRKS             MOVE PTF IN ERROR TO PRINT
         MVC   REPRTE,WRKE             MOVE FIXING APAR TO PRINT
         MVC   SUPDPE,WRKS             MOVE PE PTF TO SUPD KEY
         MVC   DLIBSYS,WRKS            MOVE PE PTF TO DLIB KEY
         MVI   FIXFND,C'N'             RESET FIX FOUND SWITCH
*
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        POSITION OURSELVES INTO THE GLOBAL ZONE AT THE FIRST
*        GLOBAL ZONE SYSMOD RECORD.
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
CHKFIX   POINT RPL=GLBLSEQ             POSITION TO GLOBAL ZONE START
         LTR   R15,R15                 OK?
         BNZ   ERROR                   NO -> ERROR
*
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        LOOK AT EACH GLOBAL ZONE SYSMOD RECORD TO SEE IF IT
*        IS THE CORRECTING PTF FOR THIS APAR FIX.
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
APARFIX  GET   RPL=GLBLSEQ             GET A RECORD
         LTR   R15,R15                 GOT IT?
         BNZ   ERROR                   NO -> ERROR
         CLC   GLOBALK,ZONE6F          LAST GLOBAL SYSMOD RECORD?
         BNE   NOFIX                   YES
         CLC   GLOBALF,TYPE7040        SUPING SYSMOD RECORD?
         BNE   APARFIX                 NO -> KEEP LOOKING
         CLC   GLOBALE,WRKE            PTF FIX FOR ARAR?
         BNE   APARFIX                 NO -> KEEP LOOKING
         MVC   REPRTF,GLOBALP          MOVE FIXING PTF TO PRINT
         MVI   FIXFND,C'Y'             INDICATE FIX FOUND
         B     CHKSUPD                 CHECK TO SEE IF IT IS SUPD
NOFIX    MVC   REPRTF,=C'       '
         MVI   FIXFND,C'N'             INDICATE FIX NOT FOUND
*
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        ONCE WE HAVE A FIXING SYSMOD, BEGIN CHECKING TO SEE IF
*        THE PTF IN ERROR HAS BEEN SUPD IN OUR TARGET ZONE.
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
CHKSUPD  GET   RPL=TARGSUP             GET PE PTF SUPD SYSMOD RECORD
         LTR   R15,R15                 FIND ONE?
         BNZ   CHKACC                  NO -> THIS PTF IS REALLY PE
         CLI   SHOWSUPD,C'S'           SHOW SUPD PE PTFS?
         BNE   NEXTPTF                 NO -> DON'T PRINT IT
*
         CLI   FIXFND,C'Y'             WAS A FIX FOUND ?
         BNE   FIXNFND                 NO -> NO FIX TO IGNORE
         MVC   REPRTM,MSG4             "PE SUPD - IGNORE FIX"
         B     PRTRPT                  GO PRINT REPORT LINE
FIXNFND  MVC   REPRTM,MSG5             "PE SUPD"
         B     PRTRPT                  GO PRINT REPORT LINE
*
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        ONCE WE HAVE A FIXING PTF THAT HASN'T BEEN SUPERSEDED,
*        SEE IF PE IS ACCEPTED INTO OUR DLIB ZONE.
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
CHKACC   CLI   FIXFND,C'Y'             WAS A FIX FOUND ?
         BE    CONTCHK                 YES -> CHECK IF PE PTF ACCEPTED
         MVC   REPRTM,MSG3             FIX NOT ON SYSTEM
         B     PRTRPT                  GO PRINT REPORT LINE
CONTCHK  GET   RPL=DLIBDIR             CHECK DLIB ZONE FOR PE PTF
         LTR   R15,R15                 PE PTF ACCEPTED?
         BNZ   NOACC                   NO -> COULD RESTORE PE PTF
         MVC   REPRTM,MSG1             "APPLY FIX"
         B     PRTRPT                  GO PRINT REPORT LINE
NOACC    MVC   REPRTM,MSG2             "RESTORE PE OR APPLY FIX"
         B     PRTRPT                  GO PRINT REPORT LINE
*
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        PRINT REPORT LINE
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
PRTRPT   PUT   REPORT,REPRT            WRITE A LINE
         B     NEXTPTF                 GET NEXT RECORD
         EJECT
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        END OF JOB ROUTINE
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*
STOP     MVC   REPRTS,=C'-------'
         MVC   REPRTE,=C'-------'
         MVC   REPRTF,=C'-------'
         MVC   REPRTM,=C'----------------------------------------'
         PUT   REPORT,REPRT            WRITE A LINE
         MVC   REPRTS,=C'*******'
         MVC   REPRTE,TZONAME
         MVC   REPRTF,DZONAME
         MVC   REPRTM,=C'PRINT AND READ MCS FOR ALL FIXES        '
         PUT   REPORT,REPRT            WRITE A LINE
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
         CLOSE (GLBLCSI,,TARGCSI,,DLIBCSI,,REPORT)
*
         LM    R0,R1,WRKSIZE           GET STORAGE SIZE AND ADDRESS
         LTR   R0,R0                   DID WE DO GETMAIN?
         BZ    STOP2                   NO -> SKIP FREEMAIN
         FREEMAIN RC,LV=(0),A=(1)      FREE THE STORAGE
*
STOP2    LA    R15,0
         #RTN
         EJECT
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
*        ERROR ROUTINES
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
ERROR    ABEND 16,DUMP
         EJECT
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
WRKSIZE  DC    F'0'                    SIZE OF STORAGE AREA
WRKADDR  DS    1A                      ADDRESS OF STORAGE AREA
ZONE02   DC    XL4'00000200'           ZONE RECORD
ZONE6F   DC    XL4'00006F00'           SYSMOD RECORD
TYPE2210 DC    XL2'2210'               HOLDERROR SYSMOD RECORD
TYPE7040 DC    XL2'7040'               SUPING SYSMOD RECORD
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
GLOBAL   DS    0CL143
GLOBALK  DC    CL4' '
GLOBALP  DC    CL7' '
         DC    CL1' '
GLOBALF  DC    CL2' '                  X'0170' = LASTSUP
*                                      X'2210' = HOLDERROR
*                                      X'7040' = SUPS
         DC    CL2' '
GLOBALE  DC    CL7' '
         DC    CL120' '
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
TZONAME  DC    CL7' '
DZONAME  DC    CL7' '
SHOWSUPD DC    CL1'N'
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
SUPDKEY  DS    0CL16
         DC    XL1'00'
SUPDHEX  DC    XL1'00'
         DC    XL1'6F'
         DC    XL1'00'
SUPDPE   DC    CL7' '
         DC    CL1' '
         DC    XL2'0170'
         DC    XL2'0000'
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
TARGKEY  DS    0CL11
         DC    XL1'00'
TARGHEX  DC    XL1'00'
         DC    XL1'6F'
         DC    XL1'00'
TARGSYS  DC    CL7' '
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
TARGET   DS    0CL143
TARGETZ  DC    CL4' '
TARGETE  DC    CL7' '
         DC    CL1' '
TARGETF  DC    CL2' '
         DC    CL2' '
TARGETS  DC    CL7' '
         DC    CL120' '
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
         ORG   TARGET
         DS    CL5
TARGETH  DS    CL1
         ORG
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
DLIBKEY  DS    0CL11
         DC    XL1'00'
DLIBHEX  DC    XL1'00'
         DC    XL1'6F'
         DC    XL1'00'
DLIBSYS  DC    CL7' '
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
DLIB     DS    0CL143
DLIBZ    DC    CL4' '
DLIBE    DC    CL7' '
         DC    CL1' '
DLIBF    DC    CL2' '
         DC    CL2' '
DLIBS    DC    CL7' '
         DC    CL120' '
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
         ORG   DLIB
         DS    CL5
DLIBH    DS    CL1
         ORG
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
REPRT    DS    0CL80
         DC    CL2' '
REPRTS   DC    CL7' '                  PTF IN ERROR
         DC    CL2' '
REPRTE   DC    CL7' '                  APAR FIX
         DC    CL2' '
REPRTF   DC    CL7' '                  FIXING PTF
         DC    CL2' '
REPRTM   DC    CL40' '                 ACTION TO BE TAKEN
         DC    CL11' '
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
MSG1     DC    CL40'APPLY FIXING PTF'
MSG2     DC    CL40'RESTORE PTF IN ERROR OR APPLY FIXING PTF'
MSG3     DC    CL40'FIXING PTF NOT ON SYSTEM * ORDER FIX'
MSG4     DC    CL40'PE HAS BEEN SUPD * FIX CAN BE IGNORED'
MSG5     DC    CL40'PE HAS BEEN SUPD'
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
EOFSW    DC    CL1'N'                  END OF FILE SWITCH
FIXFND   DC    CL1'N'                  FIXING PTF FOUND SWITCH
TZONKEY  DC    XL1'00'                 TARGET ZONE KEY
DZONKEY  DC    XL1'00'                 DLIB ZONE KEY
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
WRKAREA  DSECT
WRKS     DS    CL7                     PTF IN ERROR
WRKE     DS    CL7                     APAR FIX
WRKLEN   EQU   *-WRKAREA
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
PELISTR5 CSECT
         LTORG                         LITERAL TABLE
         EJECT
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
GLBLCSI  ACB   AM=VSAM,MACRF=(KEY,SEQ,DIR,IN),DDNAME=GLBLCSI,          +
               EXLST=CSIEXIT
TARGCSI  ACB   AM=VSAM,MACRF=(KEY,SEQ,DIR,IN),DDNAME=TARGCSI,          +
               EXLST=CSIEXIT
DLIBCSI  ACB   AM=VSAM,MACRF=(KEY,SEQ,DIR,IN),DDNAME=DLIBCSI,          +
               EXLST=CSIEXIT
GLBLSEQ  RPL   ACB=GLBLCSI,AM=VSAM,OPTCD=(KEY,SEQ,KEQ,GEN,MVE),        +
               KEYLEN=4,ARG=ZONE6F,AREA=GLOBAL,AREALEN=143
TARGDIR  RPL   ACB=TARGCSI,AM=VSAM,OPTCD=(KEY,DIR,KEQ,GEN,MVE),        +
               KEYLEN=11,ARG=TARGKEY,AREA=TARGET,AREALEN=143
TARGSEQ  RPL   ACB=TARGCSI,AM=VSAM,OPTCD=(KEY,SEQ,MVE),                +
               AREA=TARGET,AREALEN=143
TARGSUP  RPL   ACB=TARGCSI,AM=VSAM,OPTCD=(KEY,DIR,KEQ,GEN,MVE),        +
               KEYLEN=16,ARG=SUPDKEY,AREA=TARGET,AREALEN=143
DLIBDIR  RPL   ACB=DLIBCSI,AM=VSAM,OPTCD=(KEY,DIR,KEQ,GEN,MVE),        +
               KEYLEN=11,ARG=DLIBKEY,AREA=DLIB,AREALEN=143
DLIBSEQ  RPL   ACB=DLIBCSI,AM=VSAM,OPTCD=(KEY,SEQ,MVE),                +
               AREA=DLIB,AREALEN=143
CSIEXIT  EXLST AM=VSAM,EODAD=NEXTPTF
REPORT   DCB   DDNAME=REPORT,DSORG=PS,MACRF=(PM),RECFM=FB,LRECL=80,    +
               BLKSIZE=3120
*----------------------------------------------------------------------
         END

VTOCSCAN.text:
***********************************************************************
**   REGISTER USAGE                                                  **
***********************************************************************
R0       EQU   0                       RESERVED
R1       EQU   1                       PARAMETER LIST
R2       EQU   2                       CVT
R3       EQU   3                       UCB
R4       EQU   4                       SVC 99 RB
R5       EQU   5                       WORK REGISTER
R6       EQU   6                       UNUSED
R7       EQU   7                       UNUSED
R8       EQU   8
R9       EQU   9
R10      EQU   10
R11      EQU   11
R12      EQU   12                      BASE ADDRESS
R13      EQU   13                      SAVE AREA POINTER
R14      EQU   14                      RETURN ADDRESS
R15      EQU   15                      ENTRY POINT/RETURN CODE
***********************************************************************
VTOCSCAN CSECT
VTOCSCAN AMODE 24
VTOCSCAN RMODE 24
         SAVE  (14,12),,'VTOCSCAN &SYSDATE'
         LR    R12,R15                 ENTRY POINT ADDRESS
         USING VTOCSCAN,R12            ESTABLISH ADDRESSABILITY
         LA    R0,WORKLEN              LOAD SIZE OF WORK AREA
         GETMAIN R,LV=(0)              GET WORK/SAVE AREA STORAGE
         ST    R13,4(R1)               ADDRESS OF CALLER'S SAVE AREA
         ST    R1,8(R13)               ADDRESS OF OUR SAVE AREA
         L     R1,24(R13)              RESTORE PARM POINTER
         L     R13,8(R13)              GET BACK OUR SAVE AREA ADDRESS
         USING WORKAREA,R13            MAP IT
***********************************************************************
         OPEN  (SYSPRDCB,OUTPUT)
         L     R2,CVTPTR               CVT POINTER
         USING CVT,R2                  MAP THE CVT
         USING UCBBGN,R3               MAP THE UCB
         LA    R4,RB                   SVC 99 REQUEST BLOCK
         USING S99RB,R4                MAP THE RB
         ST    R4,RBP                  STORE RB ADDRESS IN POINTER LIST
         OI    RBP,X'80'               FLAG LAST POINT
*
         XC    UCB$WORK,UCB$WORK       CLEAR UCBSCAN WORK AREA
         MVI   UCB$TYPE,UCB3DACC       SEARCH FOR DASD UCBS
NEXTUCB  L     R15,CVTUCBSC            ADDRESS OF UCBSCAN ROUTINE
         CALL  (15),(UCB$WORK,UCB$TYPE,UCB$ADDR)
         LTR   R15,R15                 END OF LIST?
         BNZ   DONE                    YES -> FINISH UP
         L     R3,UCB$ADDR             GET UCB ADDRESS
         LTR   R3,R3                   REALLY A UCB?
         BZ    NEXTUCB                 NO -> GET THE NEXT ONE
         TM    UCBSTAT,UCBONLI         DEVICE ONLINE?
         BZ    NEXTUCB                 NO -> NEXT UCB
         MVC   VOLSER,UCBVOLI          SAVE THE VOLSER
         MVC   PRTVOL+1(6),UCBVOLI
         MVC   PRTVOL+9(3),UCBNAME
         PUT   SYSPRDCB,PRTVOL
*
         XC    S99RB(S99RBLEN),S99RB   CLEAR RB
         MVI   S99RBLN,S99RBLEN        STORE LENGTH OF RB
         MVI   S99VERB,S99VRBAL        INDICATE ALLOCATE
         LA    R5,TUPLAL               TEXT UNIT POINTER LIST ADDRESS
         ST    R5,S99TXTPP             STORE IT IN RB
         LA    R1,RBP
         DYNALLOC
         LTR   R15,R15                 DYNAMIC ALLOCATION FAILED?
         BNZ   NEXTUCB                 GET NEXT UCB
*
         DEVTYPE DDNAME,DEVINFO,DEVTAB
         SLR   R8,R8                   CLEAR R8 FOR DIVIDE
         LH    R9,UCBVTOC              VTOC RELATIVE TRACK ADDRESS
         LH    R10,NUMTRKS             TRACKS PER CYLINDER
         DR    R8,R10                  DIVIDE RTA TO GET CYL/TRK
         STH   R9,CC                   CYLINDER ADDRESS
         STH   R8,HH                   TRACK ADDRESS
         MVC   R(1),UCBVTOC+2          RECORD NUMBER
         OBTAIN CAMDSCB4               GET THE FORMAT 4 DSCB
*
NEXTDSCB SLR   R15,R15                 CLEAR R15 FOR IC
         IC    R15,R                   GET RECORD NUMBER
         LA    R15,1(R15)              NEXT RECORD
         STC   R15,R                   SAVE RECORD NUMBER
         CLC   R(1),DS4DEVDT           TOO HIGH FOR THIS TRACK?
         BNH   GETDSCB                 NO -> GET NEXT DSCB
         MVI   R,X'01'                 RECORD 1 OF NEXT TRACK
         LH    R15,HH                  GET TRACK NUMBER
         LA    R15,1(R15)              NEXT TRACK
         STH   R15,HH                  SAVE TRACK NUMBER
         CH    R15,NUMTRKS             TOO HIGH FOR THIS CYLINDER?
         BL    GETDSCB                 NO -> GET NEXT DSCB
         XC    HH(2),HH                TRACK 0 OF NEXT CYLINDER
         LH    R15,CC                  GET CYLINDER NUMBER
         LA    R15,1(R15)              NEXT CYLINDER
         STH   R15,CC                  SAVE CYLINDER NUMBER
GETDSCB  OBTAIN CAMDSCB1               GET THE NEXT DSCB
         CLI   DS1FMTID,C'1'           FORMAT 1 DSCB?
         BNE   CHKLAST                 NO -> ARE WE DONE YET?
         MVC   PRTDSN+4(44),DS1DSNAM
         ICM   R15,B'1111',DS1SMSFG    LOAD PREVIOUSLY RESERVED BYTES
         LTR   R15,R15                 ANYTHING SET?
         BZ    CHKLAST                 NO -> DON'T PRINT THIS DATASET
         SLR   R15,R15
         LA    R11,HEXCHAR
         IC    R15,DS1SMSFG
         SRL   R15,4
         AR    R15,R11
         MVC   PRTDSN+60(1),0(R15)
         SLR   R15,R15
         IC    R15,DS1SMSFG
         N     R15,LOW4
         AR    R15,R11
         MVC   PRTDSN+61(1),0(R15)
         SLR   R15,R15
         IC    R15,DS1SCXTF
         SRL   R15,4
         AR    R15,R11
         MVC   PRTDSN+74(1),0(R15)
         SLR   R15,R15
         IC    R15,DS1SCXTF
         N     R15,LOW4
         AR    R15,R11
         MVC   PRTDSN+75(1),0(R15)
         SLR   R15,R15
         IC    R15,DS1SCXTV
         SRL   R15,4
         AR    R15,R11
         MVC   PRTDSN+88(1),0(R15)
         SLR   R15,R15
         IC    R15,DS1SCXTV
         N     R15,LOW4
         AR    R15,R11
         MVC   PRTDSN+89(1),0(R15)
         SLR   R15,R15
         IC    R15,DS1SCXTV+1
         SRL   R15,4
         AR    R15,R11
         MVC   PRTDSN+90(1),0(R15)
         SLR   R15,R15
         IC    R15,DS1SCXTV+1
         N     R15,LOW4
         AR    R15,R11
         MVC   PRTDSN+91(1),0(R15)
         PUT   SYSPRDCB,PRTDSN
*
CHKLAST  CLC   CCHHR(5),DS4HPCHR
         BL    NEXTDSCB
*
         XC    S99RB(S99RBLEN),S99RB   CLEAR RB
         MVI   S99RBLN,S99RBLEN        STORE LENGTH OF RB
         MVI   S99VERB,S99VRBUN        INDICATE UNALLOCATE
         LA    R5,TUPLUN               TEXT UNIT POINTER LIST ADDRESS
         ST    R5,S99TXTPP             STORE IT IN RB
         LA    R1,RBP
         DYNALLOC
         B     NEXTUCB
*
DONE     CLOSE SYSPRDCB
***********************************************************************
EXIT     LR    R1,R13                  SAVE ADDRESS OF OUR SAVE AREA
         L     R13,4(R13)              POINT TO CALLER'S SAVE AREA
         FREEMAIN R,LV=WORKLEN,A=(1)   FREEMAIN OUR SAVE AREA
         XR    R15,R15                 RC = 0
         RETURN (14,12),RC=(15)        RETURN
***********************************************************************
         DS    0D
UCB$WORK DS    XL100                   UCBSCAN WORK AREA
UCB$TYPE DS    X                       DEVICE CLASS
UCB$ADDR DS    F                       UCB ADDRESS
*
CAMDSCB1 CAMLST SEEK,CCHHR,VOLSER,IECSDSF1
CAMDSCB4 CAMLST SEEK,CCHHR,VOLSER,DS4DSNAM
*
         IECSDSL1 1                    FORMAT 1 DSCB
DS4DSNAM DS    CL44
         IECSDSL1 4                    FORMAT 1 DSCB
*
CC       DS    1H
HH       DS    1H
R        DS    X
CCHHR    EQU   CC,5
*
         DS    0F
DEVINFO  EQU   *,20                    FILLED IN BY DEVTYPE MACRO
DEVTYPE  DS    1F                      UCB DEVICE TYPE
MAXBLK   DS    1F                      MAXIMUM BLKSIZE FOR DEVICE
NUMCYLS  DS    1H                      NUMBER OF CYLINDERS ON DEVICE
NUMTRKS  DS    1H                      NUMBER OF TRACKS PER CYLINDER
TRKLEN   DS    1H                      MAXIMUM TRACK LENGTH
         DS    8H                      THE REST OF THE STORY
*
LOW4     DC    F'15'
ZEROS    DC    CL4'0000'
HEXCHAR  DC    CL16'0123456789ABCDEF'
*
PRTVOL   DC    CL133'-###### (###)'
PRTDSN   DC    CL133'    ############################################  X
